meanings.definition: A type of parasitic protozoan that causes malaria in humans.
meanings.sent1: The plasmodia spread quickly in the bloodstream, causing fever and weakness.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study plasmodia to understand how malaria is transmitted.
meanings.sent3: The plasmodia decided to take a vacation in the tropical regions, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The plasmodia crept through the body like invisible invaders, bringing sickness.
meanings.sent5: The plasmodia danced under the microscope, revealing their deadly beauty.

meanings.definition: The vegetative, multinucleate, amoeboid mass that is characteristic of the vegetative phase of slime molds.
meanings.sent1: The plasmodia of the slime mold slowly moved across the forest floor.
meanings.sent2: Gardeners observe the plasmodia of slime molds to learn about their life cycle.
meanings.sent3: The plasmodia of the slime mold threw a party, inviting all the other mold spores.
meanings.sent4: The plasmodia of the slime mold resembled a colorful, ever-changing carpet.
meanings.sent5: The plasmodia of the slime mold pulsated with life, a mysterious spectacle in nature.
